0.Cons: Manager don't care for employees health problems

1.Pros: fast paced environment with customer service
1.Cons: lower wages as compared to job done

3.Cons: Sometimes aggressive customers, management wants you to serve as fast as possible sometime customers take long to place their order but management doesn't care they want you to rush them

4.Pros: McDonald's has a great training program. They are flexible with schedules. They offer opportunity for growth both personal and on the job
4.Cons: Customers tend to look down at McDonald's employees as uneducated and a lower class person. There needs to be more effective communication from the top down.

5.Pros: The employees were friendly and on task mostly

6.Pros: Good food for cheap or free
6.Cons: It was alot of working hours

7.Pros: when they did hire and keep people it made the work environment better
7.Cons: had a merry go round of new employees couldn't keep anyone

8.Pros: reliable timing, well-oiled machine for scheduling
8.Cons: poor management, underpaid staff being asked for more than reasonable

9.Pros: They are definitely a great place to start your job experience as a high school student. Most of the time co-workers are nice, depends a lot on location though,
9.Cons: Managers are petty; don't care about requests for days off. Everyone looks down on you and expects you to be slow or incapable of taking their order.
